title: Executive Order 6856-Revocation in Part of Executive Orders of March 1, 1912, and November 22, 1924, Creating Power-Site Reserves Nos. 242 and 759, Respectively
content: By virtue of and pursuant to the authority vested in me by the act of June 25, 1910 (ch. 421, 36 Stat. 847), as amended by the act of August 24, 1912 (ch. 369, 37 Stat. 497), it is hereby ordered that the Executive order of March 1, 1912, creating power-site reserve no. 242, be, and it is hereby, revoked as to the following-described lands:
T. 4 S., R. 29 E., sec. 13, SE¼SE¼.
And it is further ordered that the Executive order of November 22, 1924, creating power-site reserve no. 759, be, and it is hereby, revoked as to the following-described lands:
This order may be referred to as "power-site restoration no. 480, Arizona".
citation: Franklin D. Roosevelt, Executive Order 6856-Revocation in Part of Executive Orders of March 1, 1912, and November 22, 1924, Creating Power-Site Reserves Nos. 242 and 759, Respectively Online by Gerhard Peters and John T. Woolley, The American Presidency Project https://www.presidency.ucsb.edu/node/362562
